p: Specific parameters that define basic life-history traits were assigned to all species (cf. Table 2 for a full listing). These parameters were homogeneous throughout the entire landscape and kept constant during the simulation. Parameters were collected from various sources (e.g., [ 69â€“ 70]), including expert judgment when empirical information was unavailable. Species- and landtype-specific response parameters for the Biomass Succession extension (namely species establishment probabilities [SEP], maximum annual net primary productivity [maxANPP] and maximum AGB [maxAGB], see below) were simulated for LANDIS-II using PICUS. These three parameters (often referred to as dynamic inputs in the LANDIS-II literature) can be updated during a LANDIS-II simulation to account for the effects of climate change.
